law.catch_line: Original will may be withdrawn from court, when.
law.text: The District Court before which a will has been probated may permit any person interested to withdraw the will temporarily upon proper terms, if it is shown that the original will is necessary as evidence in any proceeding pending in a foreign government, or in any state of the United States. A copy of the will shall always be retained and entered upon the records of the court permitting the withdrawal.
law.history: Amended 1976 (1st Extra. Sess.) Ky. Acts ch. 14, sec. 365, effective January 2, 1978. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 4866.
